title: Most Hospitalized Monkeypox Patients in the U.S. Were H.I.V.-Positive
description: “Monkeypox and H.I.V. have collided,” a C.D.C. researcher said.
dc:creator: Apoorva Mandavilli
category: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
media:credit: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, via Associated Press
media:description: A scan showing monkeypox particles (red) found within an infected cell, cultured in the laboratory at the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases.
